text:
"I shouldn't trust anyone; I just can't listen," he said.

"I came to tell you that I’ve always loved you. I’m actually glad we’re alone, even glad Dounia is out," he continued, feeling a surge of emotion. "You need to know that even if you’re unhappy, your son loves you more than himself. All those times you thought I was cruel and didn’t care? That was a mistake. I’ll never stop loving you… Okay, that’s enough. I just needed to say this."

Pulcheria Alexandrovna hugged him tightly, tears in her eyes.

"I don’t know what’s going on with you, Rodya," she finally said. "I thought we were boring you, but now I feel like there’s something really heavy weighing on you. I’ve sensed it for a while. Sorry for bringing it up. I can’t stop thinking about it, and I lie awake at night worrying. Your sister was talking in her sleep about you all night. I couldn’t catch everything, but it felt ominous. I’ve felt like something bad was coming, and now it’s here! Rodya, where are you headed?"

"Yes."

"I knew it! I can come with you if you need me. Dounia loves you so much, and Sofya Semyonovna can join us too if you want. I’m happy to think of her as a daughter."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Rodya expresses his deep love for his mother while revealing a sense of impending sorrow in his life.
